*Does any one have any good ideas for adding custom classes and ID’s for DnD/Theme Style coding?* Currently, only DnD areas allow for a custom class. Modules, sections & rows have no options for this, so I’m having to use multiple DnD areas to manufacture custom classes for granular control, as well as adding ID’s via Jquery whenever I have a use case that needs an ID. Also, it would be nice if section styles for alignment and spacing had a MOBILE option so that you can tighten things up or alter spacing as things break down. Just some thoughts as I’m making the transition to the new theming dev. :slightly_smiling_face:

Also, if you run into a custom font issue with themes, I had to upload mine to a custom theme folder and reference it this way to get it to work (shout out to <@U38EZFVFE> for helping out and keeping me sane)

`@font-face {`
  `font-family: 'Custom_Font';`
  `src: url('{{get_asset_url("/Your_Theme/fonts/Custom_Font/font.woff2")}}') format('woff2'), url('{{get_asset_url("/Your_Theme/fonts/Custom_Font/font.woff")}}') format('woff');`
  `font-display: swap;`
`}`
We had to use “getAsset” to make it work. A normal URL or path does not work.

And no, you can’t make it accessible to the user to change the font later. The only set that Theme’s currently allows is the GOOGLE set, which doesn’t work with anything custom. The JSON file won’t even let you save an edit if the GOOGLE set isn’t present. So it’s best to override and comment out that part of the theme design for now until a better solution comes around for clients that have custom typography that won’t be changing for a long time anyway
